titles.title: To amend the Central Utah Project Completion Act to provide for acquisition of water and water rights for Central Utah Project purposes, completion of Central Utah project facilities, and implementation of water conservation measures.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Subcommittee on Water and Power Discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-417.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 242.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2889.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 9/21/1999--Introduced. Amends the Central Utah Project Completion Act to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to utilize up to $60 million of any unexpended budget authority provided with respect to Central Utah Project construction to provide 65 percent of the Federal share of costs to acquire water and water rights for Project purposes, including instream flows, to complete authorized Project facilities, and to implement water conservation measures.
